blocks.name: ciun
blocks.content: Extend class notation to include indexed union. Note: Historically (prior to 21-Oct-2005), set.mm used the notation ` U. x e. A B ` , with the same union symbol as ~ cuni . While that syntax was unambiguous, it did not allow for LALR parsing of the syntax constructions in set.mm. The new syntax uses a distinguished symbol ` U_ ` instead of ` U. ` and does allow LALR parsing. Thanks to Peter Backes for suggesting this change.
blocks.origin: prop class ciun(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) { â‹ƒ(s0 âˆˆ c0, c1) }

ciin
blocks.content: Extend class notation to include indexed intersection. Note: Historically (prior to 21-Oct-2005), set.mm used the notation ` |^| x e. A B ` , with the same intersection symbol as ~ cint . Although that syntax was unambiguous, it did not allow for LALR parsing of the syntax constructions in set.mm. The new syntax uses a distinguished symbol ` |^|_ ` instead of ` |^| ` and does allow LALR parsing. Thanks to Peter Backes for suggesting this change.
blocks.origin: prop class ciin(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) { â‹‚(s0 âˆˆ c0, c1) }

df-iun
blocks.content: Define indexed union. Definition indexed union in [Stoll] p. 45. In most applications, ` A ` is independent of ` x ` (although this is not required by the definition), and ` B ` depends on ` x ` i.e. can be read informally as ` B ( x ) ` . We call ` x ` the index, ` A ` the index set, and ` B ` the indexed set. In most books, ` x e. A ` is written as a subscript or underneath a union symbol ` U. ` . We use a special union symbol ` U_ ` to make it easier to distinguish from plain class union. In many theorems, you will see that ` x ` and ` A ` are in the same distinct variable group (meaning ` A ` cannot depend on ` x ` ) and that ` B ` and ` x ` do not share a distinct variable group (meaning that can be thought of as ` B ( x ) ` i.e. can be substituted with a class expression containing ` x ` ). An alternate definition tying indexed union to ordinary union is ~ dfiun2 . Theorem ~ uniiun provides a definition of ordinary union in terms of indexed union. Theorems ~ fniunfv and ~ funiunfv are useful when ` B ` is a function. (Contributed by NM, 27-Jun-1998.)

blocks.name: df-iin
blocks.content: Define indexed intersection. Definition of [Stoll] p. 45. See the remarks for its sibling operation of indexed union ~ df-iun . An alternate definition tying indexed intersection to ordinary intersection is ~ dfiin2 . Theorem ~ intiin provides a definition of ordinary intersection in terms of indexed intersection. (Contributed by NM, 27-Jun-1998.)

  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  pm5.21nii(wcel(c0, ciun(s0, c1, c2)), wrex(s0, c1, wcel(c0, c2)), wcel(c0, universe))
  elex(c0, ciun(s0, c1, c2))
  rexlimivw(s0, c1, wcel(c0, c2), wcel(c0, universe))
  elex(c0, c2)
  elab2g(hs0, c0, universe, ciun(s0, c1, c2), wrex(s0, c1, wcel(c0, c2)), wrex(s0, c1, wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))
  rexbidv(s0, c1, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wcel(c0, c2))

  df-iun(s0, hs0, c1, c2)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, universe)

  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wrex(s0, c1, wcel(c0, c2)))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)

  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
}

blocks.name: eliuni
blocks.content: Membership in an indexed union, one way. (Contributed by JJ, 27-Jul-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm eliuni(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(c2, ciun(s0, c1, c4)))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(c4, c3))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
} = {
  sylibr(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(c2, ciun(s0, c1, c4)), wrex(s0, c1, wcel(c2, c4)))
  rspcev(s0, c0, c1, wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c2, c4))
  eleq2d(c2, c4, c3, wceq(cv(s0), c0))
  eliun(s0, c2, c1, c4)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c2, c3)
}

  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  eqriv(hs0, ciun(s0, c0, ciun(s1, c1, c2)), ciun(s1, c1, ciun(s0, c0, c2)))
  3bitr4i(wcel(cv(hs0), ciun(s0, c0, ciun(s1, c1, c2))), wcel(cv(hs0), ciun(s1, c1, ciun(s0, c0, c2))), wrex(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), ciun(s1, c1, c2))), wrex(s1, c1, wcel(cv(hs0), ciun(s0, c0, c2))))
  3bitr4i(wrex(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), ciun(s1, c1, c2))), wrex(s1, c1, wcel(cv(hs0), ciun(s0, c0, c2))), wrex(s0, c0, wrex(s1, c1, wcel(cv(hs0), c2))), wrex(s1, c1, wrex(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), c2))))
  rexcom(s0, s1, c0, c1, wcel(cv(hs0), c2))
  rexbii(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), ciun(s1, c1, c2)), wrex(s1, c1, wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))
  eliun(s1, cv(hs0), c1, c2)
  rexbii(s1, c1, wcel(cv(hs0), ciun(s0, c0, c2)), wrex(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))
  eliun(s0, cv(hs0), c0, c2)
  eliun(s0, cv(hs0), c0, ciun(s1, c1, c2))
  eliun(s1, cv(hs0), c1, ciun(s0, c0, c2))

}

thm dfiunv2(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wceq(ciun(s0, c0, ciun(s1, c1, c2)), cab(s2, wrex(s0, c0, wrex(s1, c1, wcel(cv(s2), c2)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
} = {
  3eqtri(ciun(s0, c0, ciun(s1, c1, c2)), cab(s2, wrex(s0, c0, wrex(s1, c1, wcel(cv(s2), c2)))), ciun(s0, c0, cab(hs0, wrex(s1, c1, wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))), cab(s2, wrex(s0, c0, wcel(cv(s2), cab(hs0, wrex(s1, c1, wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))))))
  iuneq2i(s0, c0, ciun(s1, c1, c2), cab(hs0, wrex(s1, c1, wcel(cv(hs0), c2))))
  a1i(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wceq(ciun(s1, c1, c2), cab(hs0, wrex(s1, c1, wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))))
  df-iun(s1, hs0, c1, c2)
  df-iun(s0, s2, c0, cab(hs0, wrex(s1, c1, wcel(cv(hs0), c2))))
  abbii(s2, wrex(s0, c0, wcel(cv(s2), cab(hs0, wrex(s1, c1, wcel(cv(hs0), c2))))), wrex(s0, c0, wrex(s1, c1, wcel(cv(s2), c2))))
  rexbii(s0, c0, wcel(cv(s2), cab(hs0, wrex(s1, c1, wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))), wrex(s1, c1, wcel(cv(s2), c2)))
  elab(hs0, cv(s2), wrex(s1, c1, wcel(cv(hs0), c2)), wrex(s1, c1, wcel(cv(s2), c2)))
  vex(s2)
  rexbidv(s1, c1, wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wcel(cv(s2), c2))
  eleq1w(hs0, s2, c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.cab.s(s2, hs0, wrex(s1, c1, wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))
  diff.wrex.s(s2, s1, c1, wcel(cv(hs0), c2))
  diffss.ex(s2, s1)
  diff.wcel.s(s2, cv(hs0), c2)
  diff.cv.s(s2, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s2, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s2)
  diff.hs0.c(cv(s2))
  diff.hs0.w(wrex(s1, c1, wcel(cv(s2), c2)))
  diff.wceq.s(s1, cv(hs0), cv(s2))
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s2)
}

  âŠ¢ â‹ƒ(s0 âˆˆ c0, â‹ƒ(s1 âˆˆ c1, c2))= { s2 | âˆƒ(s0 âˆˆ c0, âˆƒ(s1 âˆˆ c1, s2 âˆˆ c2))}
  âŠ£ d(s0, s2)
  âŠ£ d(s1, s2)
  âŠ£ d(s2, c0)
  âŠ£ d(s2, c1)
  âŠ£ d(s2, c2)
} = {
  3eqtri(â‹ƒ(s0 âˆˆ c0, â‹ƒ(s1 âˆˆ c1, c2)), { s2 | âˆƒ(s0 âˆˆ c0, âˆƒ(s1 âˆˆ c1, s2 âˆˆ c2))}, â‹ƒ(s0 âˆˆ c0, { hs0 | âˆƒ(s1 âˆˆ c1, hs0 âˆˆ c2)}), { s2 | âˆƒ(s0 âˆˆ c0, s2 âˆˆ { hs0 | âˆƒ(s1 âˆˆ c1, hs0 âˆˆ c2)})})
  iuneq2i(s0, c0, â‹ƒ(s1 âˆˆ c1, c2), { hs0 | âˆƒ(s1 âˆˆ c1, hs0 âˆˆ c2)})
  a1i(s0 âˆˆ c0, â‹ƒ(s1 âˆˆ c1, c2)= { hs0 | âˆƒ(s1 âˆˆ c1, hs0 âˆˆ c2)})
  df-iun(s1, hs0, c1, c2)
  df-iun(s0, s2, c0, { hs0 | âˆƒ(s1 âˆˆ c1, hs0 âˆˆ c2)})
  abbii(s2, âˆƒ(s0 âˆˆ c0, s2 âˆˆ { hs0 | âˆƒ(s1 âˆˆ c1, hs0 âˆˆ c2)}), âˆƒ(s0 âˆˆ c0, âˆƒ(s1 âˆˆ c1, s2 âˆˆ c2)))
  rexbii(s0, c0, s2 âˆˆ { hs0 | âˆƒ(s1 âˆˆ c1, hs0 âˆˆ c2)}, âˆƒ(s1 âˆˆ c1, s2 âˆˆ c2))
  elab(hs0, s2, âˆƒ(s1 âˆˆ c1, hs0 âˆˆ c2), âˆƒ(s1 âˆˆ c1, s2 âˆˆ c2))
  vex(s2)
  rexbidv(s1, c1, hs0 = s2, hs0 âˆˆ c2, s2 âˆˆ c2)
  eleq1w(hs0, s2, c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.cab.s(s2, hs0, âˆƒ(s1 âˆˆ c1, hs0 âˆˆ c2))
  diff.wrex.s(s2, s1, c1, hs0 âˆˆ c2)
  diffss.ex(s2, s1)
  diff.wcel.s(s2, hs0, c2)
  diff.cv.s(s2, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s2, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s2)
  diff.hs0.c(s2)
  diff.hs0.w(âˆƒ(s1 âˆˆ c1, s2 âˆˆ c2))
  diff.wceq.s(s1, hs0, s2)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s2)
}

blocks.name: cbviun
blocks.content: Rule used to change the bound variables in an indexed union, with the substitution specified implicitly by the hypothesis. (Contributed by NM, 26-Mar-2006.) (Revised by Andrew Salmon, 25-Jul-2011.)
blocks.origin:
thm cbviun(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wceq(ciun(s0, c0, c1), ciun(s1, c0, c2))
  -| wnfc(s1, c1)
  -| wnfc(s0, c2)
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wceq(c1, c2))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  3eqtr4i(ciun(s0, c0, c1), ciun(s1, c0, c2), cab(hs0, wrex(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), c1))), cab(hs0, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), c2))))
  abbii(hs0, wrex(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))
  cbvrex(s0, s1, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs0), c2))
  nfcri(s1, hs0, c1)
  nfcri(s0, hs0, c2)
  eleq2d(cv(hs0), c1, c2, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  df-iun(s0, hs0, c0, c1)
  df-iun(s1, hs0, c0, c2)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
}

thm cbviun(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  âŠ¢ â‹ƒ(s0 âˆˆ c0, c1)= â‹ƒ(s1 âˆˆ c0, c2)
  âŠ£ F/(s1, c1)
  âŠ£ F/(s0, c2)
  âŠ£ (s0 = s1 â†’ c1 = c2)
  âŠ£ d(s0, c0)
  âŠ£ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  3eqtr4i(â‹ƒ(s0 âˆˆ c0, c1), â‹ƒ(s1 âˆˆ c0, c2), { hs0 | âˆƒ(s0 âˆˆ c0, hs0 âˆˆ c1)}, { hs0 | âˆƒ(s1 âˆˆ c0, hs0 âˆˆ c2)})
  abbii(hs0, âˆƒ(s0 âˆˆ c0, hs0 âˆˆ c1), âˆƒ(s1 âˆˆ c0, hs0 âˆˆ c2))
  cbvrex(s0, s1, c0, hs0 âˆˆ c1, hs0 âˆˆ c2)
  nfcri(s1, hs0, c1)
  nfcri(s0, hs0, c2)
  eleq2d(hs0, c1, c2, s0 = s1)
  df-iun(s0, hs0, c0, c1)
  df-iun(s1, hs0, c0, c2)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
}

blocks.name: cbviin
blocks.content: Change bound variables in an indexed intersection. (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 26-Aug-2009.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 14-Oct-2016.)

thm cbviin(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wceq(ciin(s0, c0, c1), ciin(s1, c0, c2))
  -| wnfc(s1, c1)
  -| wnfc(s0, c2)
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wceq(c1, c2))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  3eqtr4i(ciin(s0, c0, c1), ciin(s1, c0, c2), cab(hs0, wral(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), c1))), cab(hs0, wral(s1, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), c2))))
  abbii(hs0, wral(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wral(s1, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))
  cbvral(s0, s1, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs0), c2))
  nfcri(s1, hs0, c1)
  nfcri(s0, hs0, c2)
  eleq2d(cv(hs0), c1, c2, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  df-iin(s0, hs0, c0, c1)
  df-iin(s1, hs0, c0, c2)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
}

blocks.name: iunss
blocks.content: Subset theorem for an indexed union. (Contributed by NM, 13-Sep-2003.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 25-Jul-2011.)
blocks.origin:
thm iunss(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wb(wss(ciun(s0, c0, c1), c2), wral(s0, c0, wss(c1, c2)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  3bitri(wss(ciun(s0, c0, c1), c2), wral(s0, c0, wss(c1, c2)), wss(cab(hs0, wrex(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), c1))), c2), wal(hs0, wi(wrex(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2))))
  sseq1i(ciun(s0, c0, c1), c2, cab(hs0, wrex(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), c1))))
  df-iun(s0, hs0, c0, c1)
  abss(hs0, c2, wrex(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), c1)))
  3bitrri(wal(hs0, wi(wrex(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2))), wral(s0, c0, wss(c1, c2)), wral(s0, c0, wal(hs0, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))), wal(hs0, wral(s0, c0, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))))
  ralbii(s0, c0, wss(c1, c2), wal(hs0, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs0), c2))))
  dfss2(hs0, c1, c2)
  ralcom4(s0, hs0, c0, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))
  albii(hs0, wral(s0, c0, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs0), c2))), wi(wrex(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))
  r19.23v(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs0), c2))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(hs0), c2)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: ssiun
blocks.content: Subset implication for an indexed union. (Contributed by NM, 3-Sep-2003.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 25-Jul-2011.)
blocks.origin:
thm ssiun(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wrex(s0, c0, wss(c1, c2)), wss(c1, ciun(s0, c0, c2)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  ssrdv(hs0, c1, ciun(s0, c0, c2), wrex(s0, c0, wss(c1, c2)))
  syl6ibr(wrex(s0, c0, wss(c1, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs0), ciun(s0, c0, c2)), wrex(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))
  syl(wrex(s0, c0, wss(c1, c2)), wi(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wrex(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), c2))), wrex(s0, c0, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs0), c2))))
  reximi(s0, c0, wss(c1, c2), wi(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))
  ssel(c1, c2, cv(hs0))
  r19.37v(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs0), c2))
  eliun(s0, cv(hs0), c0, c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(ciun(s0, c0, c2))
  diff.hs0.w(wrex(s0, c0, wss(c1, c2)))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(hs0), c1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

  ssel(c1, c2, hs0)

blocks.origin:
thm ssiun2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {

thm ssiun2s(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c2, ciun(s0, c1, c3)))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(c3, c2))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  vtoclgaf(s0, c0, c1, wss(c2, ciun(s0, c1, c3)), wss(c3, ciun(s0, c1, c3)))
  nfcv(s0, c0)
  nfss(s0, c2, ciun(s0, c1, c3))
  nfcv(s0, c2)
  nfiu1(s0, c1, c3)
  sseq1d(c3, ciun(s0, c1, c3), c2, wceq(cv(s0), c0))
  ssiun2(s0, c1, c3)
}

thm ssiun2s(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  âŠ¢ (c0 âˆˆ c1 â†’ c2 âŠ† â‹ƒ(s0 âˆˆ c1, c3))
  âŠ£ (s0 = c0 â†’ c3 = c2)
  âŠ£ d(s0, c0)
  âŠ£ d(s0, c1)
  âŠ£ d(s0, c2)
} = {
  vtoclgaf(s0, c0, c1, c2 âŠ† â‹ƒ(s0 âˆˆ c1, c3), c3 âŠ† â‹ƒ(s0 âˆˆ c1, c3))
  nfcv(s0, c0)
  nfss(s0, c2, â‹ƒ(s0 âˆˆ c1, c3))
  nfcv(s0, c2)
  nfiu1(s0, c1, c3)
  sseq1d(c3, â‹ƒ(s0 âˆˆ c1, c3), c2, s0 = c0)

}

blocks.name: iunss2
blocks.content: A subclass condition on the members of two indexed classes ` C ( x ) ` and ` D ( y ) ` that implies a subclass relation on their indexed unions. Generalization of Proposition 8.6 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 59. Compare ~ uniss2 . (Contributed by NM, 9-Dec-2004.)

  nfcv(s1, c0)

  nfab1(s1, wrex(s0, c0, w0))
  3bitr4i(wcel(cv(s1), ciun(s0, c0, cab(s1, w0))), wcel(cv(s1), cab(s1, wrex(s0, c0, w0))), wrex(s0, c0, wcel(cv(s1), cab(s1, w0))), wrex(s0, c0, w0))
  rexbii(s0, c0, wcel(cv(s1), cab(s1, w0)), w0)
  abid(s1, w0)
  eliun(s0, cv(s1), c0, cab(s1, w0))
  abid(s1, wrex(s0, c0, w0))
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)

blocks.name: iunxdif2
blocks.content: Indexed union with a class difference as its index. (Contributed by NM, 10-Dec-2004.)
blocks.origin:
thm iunxdif2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wral(s0, c0, wrex(s1, cdif(c0, c1), wss(c2, c3))), wceq(ciun(s1, cdif(c0, c1), c3), ciun(s0, c0, c2)))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wceq(c2, c3))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
} = {
  sylibr(wral(s0, c0, wrex(s1, cdif(c0, c1), wss(c2, c3))), wceq(ciun(s1, cdif(c0, c1), c3), ciun(s0, c0, c2)), wa(wss(ciun(s1, cdif(c0, c1), c3), ciun(s0, c0, c2)), wss(ciun(s0, c0, c2), ciun(s1, cdif(c0, c1), c3))))
  jctil(wral(s0, c0, wrex(s1, cdif(c0, c1), wss(c2, c3))), wss(ciun(s1, cdif(c0, c1), c3), ciun(s0, c0, c2)), wss(ciun(s0, c0, c2), ciun(s1, cdif(c0, c1), c3)))
  iunss2(s0, s1, c0, cdif(c0, c1), c2, c3)
  sseqtr4i(ciun(s1, cdif(c0, c1), c3), ciun(s0, c0, c2), ciun(s1, c0, c3))
  ax-mp(wss(ciun(s1, cdif(c0, c1), c3), ciun(s1, c0, c3)), wss(cdif(c0, c1), c0))
  difss(c0, c1)
  iunss1(s1, cdif(c0, c1), c0, c3)
  cbviunv(s0, s1, c0, c2, c3)
  eqss(ciun(s1, cdif(c0, c1), c3), ciun(s0, c0, c2))
  diff.cdif.s(s0, c0, c1)
  diff.cdif.s(s1, c0, c1)
}

thm iunxdif2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  âŠ¢ (âˆ€(s0 âˆˆ c0, âˆƒ(s1 âˆˆ(c0 \ c1), c2 âŠ† c3))â†’ â‹ƒ(s1 âˆˆ(c0 \ c1), c3)= â‹ƒ(s0 âˆˆ c0, c2))
  âŠ£ (s0 = s1 â†’ c2 = c3)

} = {

  jctil(âˆ€(s0 âˆˆ c0, âˆƒ(s1 âˆˆ(c0 \ c1), c2 âŠ† c3)), â‹ƒ(s1 âˆˆ(c0 \ c1), c3)âŠ† â‹ƒ(s0 âˆˆ c0, c2), â‹ƒ(s0 âˆˆ c0, c2)âŠ† â‹ƒ(s1 âˆˆ(c0 \ c1), c3))
  iunss2(s0, s1, c0, (c0 \ c1), c2, c3)
  sseqtr4i(â‹ƒ(s1 âˆˆ(c0 \ c1), c3), â‹ƒ(s0 âˆˆ c0, c2), â‹ƒ(s1 âˆˆ c0, c3))
  ax-mp(â‹ƒ(s1 âˆˆ(c0 \ c1), c3)âŠ† â‹ƒ(s1 âˆˆ c0, c3), (c0 \ c1)âŠ† c0)
  difss(c0, c1)
  iunss1(s1, (c0 \ c1), c0, c3)
  cbviunv(s0, s1, c0, c2, c3)
  eqss(â‹ƒ(s1 âˆˆ(c0 \ c1), c3), â‹ƒ(s0 âˆˆ c0, c2))

  diff.cdif.s(s1, c0, c1)
}

  ralbii(s0, c1, wss(c0, c2), wral(hs0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))

thm iinss(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wrex(s0, c0, wss(c1, c2)), wss(ciin(s0, c0, c1), c2))

  ssrdv(hs0, ciin(s0, c0, c1), c2, wrex(s0, c0, wss(c1, c2)))

  elv(hs0, wb(wcel(cv(hs0), ciin(s0, c0, c1)), wral(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), c1))))
  eliin(s0, cv(hs0), universe, c0, c1)
  syl(wrex(s0, c0, wss(c1, c2)), wi(wral(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2)), wrex(s0, c0, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs0), c2))))
  reximi(s0, c0, wss(c1, c2), wi(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))
  ssel(c1, c2, cv(hs0))
  r19.36v(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs0), c2))
  diff.hs0.c(ciin(s0, c0, c1))
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.w(wrex(s0, c0, wss(c1, c2)))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(hs0), c2)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: viin

thm 2iunin(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {

  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
} = {

  iuneq2i(s0, c0, ciun(s1, c1, cin(c2, c3)), cin(c2, ciun(s1, c1, c3)))

  iunin1(s0, c0, c2, ciun(s1, c1, c3))

}

blocks.name: iinin1
blocks.content: Indexed intersection of intersection. Generalization of half of theorem "Distributive laws" in [Enderton] p. 30. Use ~ intiin to recover Enderton's theorem. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Mar-2015.)

blocks.name: iinvdif
blocks.content: The indexed intersection of a complement. (Contributed by Gérard Lang, 5-Aug-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm iinvdif(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wceq(ciin(s0, c0, cdif(universe, c1)), cdif(universe, ciun(s0, c0, c1)))

} = {
  pm2.61ine(c0, emptycls, wceq(ciin(s0, c0, cdif(universe, c1)), cdif(universe, ciun(s0, c0, c1))))
  3eqtr4a(ciin(s0, c0, cdif(universe, c1)), cdif(universe, ciun(s0, c0, c1)), ciin(s0, emptycls, cdif(universe, c1)), cdif(universe, ciun(s0, emptycls, c1)), wceq(c0, emptycls))
  3eqtr4ri(ciin(s0, emptycls, cdif(universe, c1)), cdif(universe, ciun(s0, emptycls, c1)), cdif(universe, emptycls), universe)
  dif0(universe)
  difeq2i(universe, ciun(s0, emptycls, c1), emptycls)
  0iun(s0, c1)
  0iin(s0, cdif(universe, c1))
  iineq1(s0, c0, emptycls, cdif(universe, c1))
  difeq2d(universe, ciun(s0, c0, c1), ciun(s0, emptycls, c1), wceq(c0, emptycls))
  iuneq1(s0, c0, emptycls, c1)
  iindif2(s0, c0, universe, c1)
  diff.emptycls.s(s0)
  diff.universe.s(s0)
}

  mpan(wne(c1, emptycls), wceq(cin(c0, ciin(s0, c1, crab(s1, c0, w0))), ciin(s0, c1, crab(s1, c0, w0))), wral(s0, c1, wss(crab(s1, c0, w0), c0)))

blocks.name: symdifid
blocks.content: The symmetric difference of a class with itself is the empty class. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 25-Apr-2012.)

blocks.name: iinxsng
blocks.content: A singleton index picks out an instance of an indexed intersection's argument. (Contributed by NM, 15-Jan-2012.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 17-Nov-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm iinxsng(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(ciin(s0, csn(c0), c2), c3))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(c2, c3))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
} = {
  syl5eq(ciin(s0, csn(c0), c2), c3, cab(hs0, wral(s0, csn(c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c2))), wcel(c0, c1))
  df-iin(s0, hs0, csn(c0), c2)
  abbi1dv(hs0, c3, wcel(c0, c1), wral(s0, csn(c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))
  ralsng(s0, c0, c1, wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wcel(cv(hs0), c3))
  eleq2d(cv(hs0), c2, c3, wceq(cv(s0), c0))
  diff.hs0.c(csn(c0))
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c0, c1))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(hs0), c3)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

  âŠ¢ (c0 âˆˆ c1 â†’ â‹‚(s0 âˆˆ { c0 }, c2)= c3)
  âŠ£ (s0 = c0 â†’ c2 = c3)
  âŠ£ d(s0, c0)
  âŠ£ d(s0, c3)
} = {
  syl5eq(â‹‚(s0 âˆˆ { c0 }, c2), c3, { hs0 | âˆ€(s0 âˆˆ { c0 }, hs0 âˆˆ c2)}, c0 âˆˆ c1)
  df-iin(s0, hs0, { c0 }, c2)
  abbi1dv(hs0, c3, c0 âˆˆ c1, âˆ€(s0 âˆˆ { c0 }, hs0 âˆˆ c2))
  ralsng(s0, c0, c1, hs0 âˆˆ c2, hs0 âˆˆ c3)

  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.w(c0 âˆˆ c1)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, hs0, c3)

  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)

}

thm iinxprg(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {

  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c2), wceq(c4, c6))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)

blocks.name: iunxprg
blocks.content: A pair index picks out two instances of an indexed union's argument. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 2-Feb-2018.)

thm iunxprg(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wceq(ciun(s0, cpr(c0, c2), c4), cun(c5, c6)))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(c4, c5))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c2), wceq(c4, c6))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
} = {
  syl5eq(ciun(s0, cpr(c0, c2), c4), cun(c5, c6), cun(ciun(s0, csn(c0), c4), ciun(s0, csn(c2), c4)), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)))
  eqtri(ciun(s0, cpr(c0, c2), c4), cun(ciun(s0, csn(c0), c4), ciun(s0, csn(c2), c4)), ciun(s0, cun(csn(c0), csn(c2)), c4))
  ax-mp(wceq(ciun(s0, cpr(c0, c2), c4), ciun(s0, cun(csn(c0), csn(c2)), c4)), wceq(cpr(c0, c2), cun(csn(c0), csn(c2))))
  df-pr(c0, c2)
  iuneq1(s0, cpr(c0, c2), cun(csn(c0), csn(c2)), c4)
  iunxun(s0, csn(c0), csn(c2), c4)
  uneq12d(ciun(s0, csn(c0), c4), ciun(s0, csn(c2), c4), c5, c6, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wceq(ciun(s0, csn(c0), c4), c5))
  iunxsng(s0, c0, c1, c4, c5)
  adantl(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wceq(ciun(s0, csn(c2), c4), c6))
  iunxsng(s0, c2, c3, c4, c6)

  diff.cun.s(s0, csn(c0), csn(c2))
  diff.csn.s(s0, c0)
  diff.csn.s(s0, c2)
}

blocks.content: A relationship involving union and indexed intersection. Exercise 23 of [Enderton] p. 33. (Contributed by NM, 25-Nov-2003.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 17-Nov-2016.)

thm iinuni(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wceq(cun(c0, cint(c1)), ciin(s0, c1, cun(c0, cv(s0))))

} = {
  3eqtr4i(cun(c0, cint(c1)), ciin(s0, c1, cun(c0, cv(s0))), cab(hs0, wo(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), cint(c1)))), cab(hs0, wral(s0, c1, wcel(cv(hs0), cun(c0, cv(s0))))))

blocks.name: iununi
blocks.content: A relationship involving union and indexed union. Exercise 25 of [Enderton] p. 33. (Contributed by NM, 25-Nov-2003.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 17-Nov-2016.)

thm iununi(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wb(wi(wceq(c0, emptycls), wceq(c1, emptycls)), wceq(cun(c1, cuni(c0)), ciun(s0, c0, cun(c1, cv(s0)))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  impbii(wi(wceq(c0, emptycls), wceq(c1, emptycls)), wceq(cun(c1, cuni(c0)), ciun(s0, c0, cun(c1, cv(s0)))))
  3eqtr4g(cun(c1, cuni(c0)), ciun(s0, c0, cun(c1, cv(s0))), cun(c1, ciun(s0, c0, cv(s0))), cun(ciun(s0, c0, c1), ciun(s0, c0, cv(s0))), wi(wceq(c0, emptycls), wceq(c1, emptycls)))
  uneq1d(c1, ciun(s0, c0, cv(s0)), ciun(s0, c0, c1), wi(wceq(c0, emptycls), wceq(c1, emptycls)))
  eqcomd(c1, ciun(s0, c0, c1), wi(wceq(c0, emptycls), wceq(c1, emptycls)))
  ja(wceq(c0, emptycls), wceq(c1, emptycls), wceq(ciun(s0, c0, c1), c1))
  sylbir(wn(wceq(c0, emptycls)), wceq(ciun(s0, c0, c1), c1), wne(c0, emptycls))
  df-ne(c0, emptycls)
  iunconst(s0, c0, c1)
  3eqtr4a(ciun(s0, c0, c1), c1, ciun(s0, c0, emptycls), emptycls, wceq(c1, emptycls))
  iun0(s0, c0)
  iuneq2d(s0, c0, c1, emptycls, wceq(c1, emptycls))
  id(wceq(c1, emptycls))
  uneq2i(c1, cuni(c0), ciun(s0, c0, cv(s0)))
  uniiun(s0, c0)
  iunun(s0, c0, c1, cv(s0))
  biimpcd(wceq(cun(c1, cuni(c0)), ciun(s0, c0, cun(c1, cv(s0)))), wceq(c0, emptycls), wceq(c1, emptycls))
  eqeq12d(cun(c1, cuni(c0)), ciun(s0, c0, cun(c1, cv(s0))), c1, emptycls, wceq(c0, emptycls))
  syl6eq(cun(c1, cuni(c0)), c1, cun(c1, emptycls), wceq(c0, emptycls))
  uneq2d(c1, cuni(c0), emptycls, wceq(c0, emptycls))
  syl6eq(cuni(c0), emptycls, cuni(emptycls), wceq(c0, emptycls))
  unieq(c0, emptycls)
  uni0()
  un0(c1)
  syl6eq(ciun(s0, c0, cun(c1, cv(s0))), emptycls, ciun(s0, emptycls, cun(c1, cv(s0))), wceq(c0, emptycls))
  iuneq1(s0, c0, emptycls, cun(c1, cv(s0)))
  0iun(s0, cun(c1, cv(s0)))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, c1, emptycls)
  diff.emptycls.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: sspwuni
blocks.content: Subclass relationship for power class and union. (Contributed by NM, 18-Jul-2006.)

blocks.name: pwssb
blocks.content: Two ways to express a collection of subclasses. (Contributed by NM, 19-Jul-2006.)

blocks.name: elpwpw
blocks.content: Characterization of the elements of a double power class: they are exactly the sets whose union is included in that class. (Contributed by BJ, 29-Apr-2021.)

blocks.name: pwpwab
blocks.content: The double power class written as a class abstraction: the class of sets whose union is included in the given class. (Contributed by BJ, 29-Apr-2021.)

blocks.name: pwpwssunieq
blocks.content: The class of sets whose union is equal to a given class is included in the double power class of that class. (Contributed by BJ, 29-Apr-2021.)

blocks.name: elpwuni
blocks.content: Relationship for power class and union. (Contributed by NM, 18-Jul-2006.)

blocks.name: iinpw
blocks.content: The power class of an intersection in terms of indexed intersection. Exercise 24(a) of [Enderton] p. 33. (Contributed by NM, 29-Nov-2003.)
blocks.origin:
thm iinpw(setvar s0, class c0) {
  |- wceq(cpw(cint(c0)), ciin(s0, c0, cpw(cv(s0))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  eqriv(hs0, cpw(cint(c0)), ciin(s0, c0, cpw(cv(s0))))
  3bitr4i(wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(cint(c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), ciin(s0, c0, cpw(cv(s0)))), wss(cv(hs0), cint(c0)), wral(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(cv(s0)))))
  bitr4i(wss(cv(hs0), cint(c0)), wral(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(cv(s0)))), wral(s0, c0, wss(cv(hs0), cv(s0))))
  ssint(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  ralbii(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(cv(s0))), wss(cv(hs0), cv(s0)))
  selpw(hs0, cv(s0))
  selpw(hs0, cint(c0))
  elv(hs0, wb(wcel(cv(hs0), ciin(s0, c0, cpw(cv(s0)))), wral(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(cv(s0))))))
  eliin(s0, cv(hs0), universe, c0, cpw(cv(s0)))
  diff.hs0.c(cpw(cint(c0)))
  diff.hs0.c(ciin(s0, c0, cpw(cv(s0))))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(cv(s0))
  diff.hs0.c(cint(c0))
}

blocks.content: Inclusion of an indexed union of a power class in the power class of the union of its index. Part of Exercise 24(b) of [Enderton] p. 33. (Contributed by NM, 25-Nov-2003.)
blocks.origin:
thm iunpwss(setvar s0, class c0) {
  |- wss(ciun(s0, c0, cpw(cv(s0))), cpw(cuni(c0)))

  ssiun(s0, c0, cv(hs0), cv(s0))
  bitri(wcel(cv(hs0), ciun(s0, c0, cpw(cv(s0)))), wrex(s0, c0, wss(cv(hs0), cv(s0))), wrex(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(cv(s0)))))
  eliun(s0, cv(hs0), c0, cpw(cv(s0)))

  bitri(wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(cuni(c0))), wss(cv(hs0), ciun(s0, c0, cv(s0))), wss(cv(hs0), cuni(c0)))
  selpw(hs0, cuni(c0))
  sseq2i(cv(hs0), cuni(c0), ciun(s0, c0, cv(s0)))
  uniiun(s0, c0)
  diff.hs0.c(ciun(s0, c0, cpw(cv(s0))))
  diff.hs0.c(cpw(cuni(c0)))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)

  diff.hs0.c(cuni(c0))
}
